summary: We reviewed how well the Army kept track of ammunition being repaired at sites that contractors own and operate. This included Stinger air defense missiles, Javelin anti-tank missiles, and more. We estimate the Army didn't properly account for at least 95% of the ammunition held at these sites, as of July 2024. The Army was unaware of which sites held ammunition. Initially, the Army told...
title: DOD Financial Management: Actions Needed to Account for Army Ammunition at Contractor-Owned, Contractor-Operated Sites
